coverages.coverage_name: Trip cancellation and loss of deposit

conditional_limits.condition: Resulting from Pre-existing medical condition (Requires optional cover purchase)
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

conditional_limits.condition: Cancel for any reason (Requires optional cover purchase)

limits.type: Overall limit for family plan (50% reimbursement)

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for unused travel costs if the entire trip is cancelled within 30 days before departure due to specified events (e.g., serious injury/illness, death of you/companion/family member, witness call, home damage, serious public event, airline cancellation due to specific reasons, hijack >12hrs).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 10, Trip cancellation and loss of deposit

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: You must first request refunds from providers. Claim reduced by any refund received (cash, voucher, credits etc.). Single trip policy ends if this benefit is paid. Excludes claims if policy purchased less than 72 hours before departure.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 11, What you should know / What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Cancel for any reason' cover: Must be purchased within 7 days of initial trip deposit. Covers cancellation for reasons not listed in the standard benefit. Reimburses 50% of costs up to the limit.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Pre-existing medical conditions' cover: Covers cancellation directly due to a pre-existing condition of insured persons who purchased the cover. Subject to 50% co-payment. Excludes claims if cover purchased <72hrs before departure.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 22 & 25, Pre-existing medical conditions

conditional_limits.condition: Resulting from Pre-existing medical condition (Requires optional cover purchase)
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

conditional_limits.condition: Postpone for any reason (Requires optional cover purchase)

limits.type: Overall limit for family plan (50% reimbursement)

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for rebooking fees if the entire trip is postponed within 30 days before departure due to specified events (e.g., serious injury/illness, death, witness call, home damage, serious public event). Trip must be reorganised to the same destination within 180 days.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 10, Trip postponement & Page 11, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: You must first request refunds from providers. Claim reduced by any refund received. Single trip policy ends if this benefit is paid. Excludes claims if policy purchased less than 72 hours before departure.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 11, What you should know / What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Cancel for any reason' cover: Must be purchased within 7 days of initial trip deposit. Covers postponement for reasons not listed in the standard benefit. Reimburses 50% of costs up to the limit.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Pre-existing medical conditions' cover: Covers postponement directly due to a pre-existing condition of insured persons who purchased the cover. Subject to 50% co-payment. Excludes claims if cover purchased <72hrs before departure.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 22 & 25, Pre-existing medical conditions

conditional_limits.condition: Resulting from Pre-existing medical condition (Requires optional cover purchase)
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

conditional_limits.condition: Cut short for any reason (Requires optional cover purchase)

limits.type: Overall limit for family plan (50% reimbursement)

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for additional transport/accommodation (economy/standard) or administrative costs to return to Singapore early due to specified events occurring overseas (e.g., serious injury/illness confirmed overseas, death, witness call, home damage, serious public event, hijack >12hrs).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 10, Trip cut short & Page 11, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: You must first request refunds from providers. Claim reduced by any refund received. Excludes cost of original unused return ticket, additional expenses if no return ticket was originally purchased, costs for buses, taxis, ride-hailing.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 11, What you should know / What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Cancel for any reason' cover: Must be purchased within 7 days of initial trip deposit. Covers cutting short for reasons not listed in the standard benefit, provided trip commenced for 48+ hours. Reimburses 50% of costs up to the limit.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Pre-existing medical conditions' cover: Covers cutting short directly due to a pre-existing condition of insured persons who purchased the cover. Subject to 50% co-payment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 22 & 25, Pre-existing medical conditions

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for unused prepaid costs or additional transport/accommodation if trip cancelled before departure or disrupted overseas due to declared insolvency of travel agent, transport provider, tour operator, or accommodation provider.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Insolvency protection

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Insolvency defined as unable to pay debts and ceased operations due to declared insolvency, owner convictions/investigation for fraud, or owner absconding with funds. Excludes refunds received. Excludes claims if policy purchased less than 72 hours before departure.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Meaning of insolvency / What is not covered

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours diverted while overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays benefit for each 6 continuous hours an airplane is diverted to another destination before reaching the scheduled destination.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Trip diversion & Page 13, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires written proof of diversion from the public transport provider or handling agent showing hours and reason.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What you should know

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours delay
S$100 for the first six hours delay only

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays benefit if scheduled public transport is delayed or overbooked for 6 continuous hours or more.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Travel delay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Benefit paid for each 6 continuous hours of delay overseas, but only for the first 6 hours if delay occurs in Singapore. Requires written proof from provider showing hours and reason. Excludes delays caused by you, your family member or travel companion.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What we pay / What you should know / What is not covered

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours you are stranded

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays benefit if you miss a travel connection because your scheduled public transport arrives late at the transit terminal, and no alternative travel is available within 6 hours.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Missed connections

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Benefit paid for each 6 continuous hours stranded. Requires written proof of delay from provider. Excludes delays caused by you, your family member or travel companion.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What we pay / What you should know / What is not covered

conditional_limits.condition: Resulting from Pre-existing medical condition (Requires optional cover purchase)
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 23, Trip disruption

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for additional transport/accommodation or unused prepaid expenses if trip itinerary is changed while in Singapore or overseas due to: your serious injury/illness making you unfit to travel (confirmed by doctor), a serious public event, or flight cancellation by airline due to airport/runway/airspace closure or poor weather.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, Trip disruption & Page 13, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: You must first ask for refunds from providers. Claim reduced by any refund received. Excludes expenses to extend trip longer than originally scheduled, upgrades, expenses related to buses/taxis/ride-hailing, airline fault cancellations (e.g. aircrew rotation).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What you should know / What is not covered & Page 14

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Pre-existing medical conditions' cover: Covers disruption directly due to a pre-existing condition making you unfit to travel (confirmed by doctor). Subject to 50% co-payment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 23, Trip disruption

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: The policy pays benefits for claims that result directly from an act of terrorism during the trip, subject to the limits and conditions specified for each benefit section.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, Terrorism cover

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Act of terrorism is defined as an act involving force or violence by any person or group for political, religious, ideological or similar purposes to influence government or put the public in fear.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, Definition

base_limits.basis: S$150 for every six hours of delay
S$150 for first six hour delay in Singapore only

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays benefit for each 6-hour period checked-in baggage is delayed, misdirected, or misplaced by a public transport provider, starting 6 hours after arrival at destination (including Singapore return).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, Baggage delay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Benefit paid per claim, not per piece of baggage. Requires written proof from provider/agent stating name, date, time, delay duration, and reason.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, What we pay / What you should know

coverages.coverage_name: Theft of or damage to baggage or personal belongings

base_limits.type: Sub-limit for all other items (per item)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers items stolen, accidentally damaged during trip, or lost while in custody of airline operator. Payment based on depreciation or S$50 (whichever higher) with proof of purchase; current market value up to S$50/item (max 5 items) without proof. FWD decides repair/replace/cash. Damaged items may become FWD property.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, Theft of or damage to baggage or personal belongings & Page 15, How much we pay & Page 36, How we pay property claims

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Depreciation: Mobile phone [(24-age)/24]*price; Laptop/tablet [(36-age)/36]*price; Other belongings [(60-age)/60]*price; Jewellery 100% of price (all capped at max benefit limit).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 15, Table

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Electronics & jewellery must be carried by you (not checked-in or left unattended in vehicle). Items must be under your care or authorized person's care. Theft must be reported to police/authority within 24 hours. Benefit reduced by any Baggage Delay payout for the same items.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 15, What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Excludes perishables, consumables, vehicles, cash/travel/gift cards, wear & tear, gradual deterioration, musical instruments, unauthorized phone costs, items not belonging to you, sports equipment, business goods, stored data, unexplained loss/mysterious disappearance.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 15, What is not covered

coverages.coverage_name: Loss of passport, travel documents & theft of money

base_limits.type: Sub-limit for theft of your money

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses the cost to replace passport or other travel documents while overseas, and the value of stolen cash or travellers' cheques (up to the sub-limit).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, Loss of passport, travel documents & theft of money

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Money must have been stolen while carried by you (not checked-in or left unattended in vehicle). Stolen/lost items must have been under your care, securely locked, or in care of authorized person. Must report loss/theft to police/authority within 24 hours. Call Emergency Assistance (+65 6322 2072) for advice on replacing documents.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses unauthorized charges made on your credit card while overseas on a trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, Fraudulent personal credit card usage

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Must report unauthorized charges or card theft to credit card issuer AND police in the country where it happened within 24 hours of discovery. Must follow card issuer's rules for dealing with such charges. Excludes charges made by family member, travel companion, or anyone entrusted with card details.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, What you should know / What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses the excess or deductible you are legally required to pay due to accidental loss or damage to a rental car from a licensed operator overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Car rental excess

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Must be a named driver, legally allowed to drive overseas, driving at the time, and followed rental agreement rules and local laws. Requires copy of rental agreement, receipts for excess paid, and related reports. Car must be collected overseas. Only one claim paid per rental car across all policies.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Car rental excess / What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: This cover is included at no additional cost for Business plans.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 28

conditional_limits.condition: Resulting from Pre-existing medical condition (Requires optional cover purchase)
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 24, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers transport to a suitable medical facility or back to Singapore if medically necessary due to a life-threatening illness or injury overseas. Also covers repatriation of remains if death occurs overseas. FWD decides on transport method and facility.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires contacting Emergency Assistance line (+65 6322 2072). Covers air/surface ambulance, regular transport, admin fees for changing tickets, reasonable overseas mortician/undertaker costs (embalmment, cremation, basic casket/urn).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Pre-existing medical conditions' cover: Covers evacuation/repatriation directly due to a pre-existing condition up to the specified limit. Requires contacting Emergency Assistance.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 24, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation

coverages.coverage_name: Personal liability while on your trip

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers your legal responsibility for accidentally causing death or bodily injury to another person, or loss or damage to another person's property while overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, Personal liability while on your trip

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays damages awarded by a court (excluding punitive damages) and legal costs agreed by FWD. You must not admit liability, negotiate, or reject claims without FWD's written permission. FWD may take over legal defence. Excludes damages from criminal proceedings, loss/damage to property in your care/custody, liability from owning/using firearms, animals, motorised vehicles, watercraft, aircraft (incl. drones), remote controlled devices, bicycles, or engaging in trade/business/profession.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, What we pay / What you should know / What is not covered

base_limits.type: Child covered under a family plan

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a lump sum if you suffer an accident during the trip that causes death or total and permanent disability within 90 days.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 18, Personal accident

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Total and permanent disability defined as being unable to work for 6 consecutive months due to the accident and deemed unlikely ever to work again. Benefit paid according to a percentage scale based on the type of injury (e.g., loss of limb, sight, burns). Maximum payout is 100% of the sum insured per person per accident. Covers disappearance if on public transport that is wrecked/sunk and body not found after 1 year (paid upon official death certificate or after 1 year).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 18, Meaning of total and permanent disability / What we pay / What you should know

base_limits.type: Child covered under a family plan
Sub-limit for dental expenses caused by accident

conditional_limits.condition: Resulting from Pre-existing medical condition (Requires optional cover purchase)
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 24, Medical expenses incurred overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses costs for medically necessary treatment received overseas due to an unexpected illness or injury suffered during the trip. Covers treatment for up to 30 days from the date of first treatment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Medical expenses incurred overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Includes reasonable ambulance costs, treatment by a medical specialist if referred by a general practitioner, mobility aids (like crutches, wheelchairs - excludes prosthesis), medical equipment, and dental treatment necessary for injury caused by accident. Excludes dental treatment for tooth/gum disease or normal wear, non-natural teeth (dentures, implants), treatment by an interested party, planned or pre-arranged overseas medical treatment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, What we pay / What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Pre-existing medical conditions' cover: Covers medically necessary treatment overseas directly due to a pre-existing condition up to the specified limit. Exclusions for dental, interested party, planned treatment still apply.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 24, Medical expenses incurred overseas & Page 26

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 7, Daily hospital cash while overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a daily benefit for each continuous 24-hour period you are confined to a hospital overseas due to an unexpected illness or injury suffered on the trip. Admission must be medically necessary.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Daily hospital cash while overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: The daily cash amount is doubled for confinement in an intensive care unit (ICU), subject to the doubled cap.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Double daily hospital cash benefit for ICU

conditional_limits.condition: Resulting from Pre-existing medical condition (Requires optional cover purchase)
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 24, Automatic policy extension

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Insurance period is automatically extended free of charge if your return to Singapore is delayed by a serious public event, or if you are confined to an overseas hospital on advice of a medical practitioner.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Automatic policy extension

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: For 'Pre-existing medical conditions' cover: Extended if unfit to travel or hospitalised overseas due to the pre-existing condition (requires doctor confirmation).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 24, Automatic policy extension

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses the costs of phone calls made while overseas to: FWD Emergency Assistance hotline (for medical help or lost documents), police, medical facilities, consulates, or family members in Singapore for assistance/support due to suffering a serious illness or injury during the trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Emergency phone charges

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses reasonable return economy transport and standard accommodation costs for one adult family member (or travel companion) to travel to be with you if you suffer an unexpected illness/injury overseas AND are confined to hospital for at least 5 continuous days AND a doctor confirms you cannot return to Singapore for treatment AND you have no adult family member with you.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Hospitalisation visit & Page 20, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Benefit stops paying at the earlier of: 30 days passing since first confinement, or the date a doctor confirms you are fit to continue trip or return to Singapore. If you die while hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation Visit, Child Companion, or Compassionate Travel) is payable.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, What we pay / What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses reasonable return economy transport and standard accommodation costs for one adult family member to travel to be with you if you suffer an unexpected illness/injury overseas AND are confined to hospital for at least 5 continuous days AND a doctor confirms you cannot return to Singapore for treatment AND you are travelling with one or more children AND you are the only adult.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Child companion & Page 20, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Benefit stops paying at the earlier of: 30 days passing since first confinement, or the date a doctor confirms you are fit to continue trip or return to Singapore. If you die while hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation Visit, Child Companion, or Compassionate Travel) is payable.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, What we pay / What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses reasonable return economy transport and standard accommodation costs for one adult family member to travel to arrange the return of your bodily remains to Singapore or your home country if you die from an unexpected illness or injury suffered while overseas on the trip AND there is no other adult family member on the trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Compassionate travel & Page 20, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: If you die while hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation Visit, Child Companion, or Compassionate Travel) is payable.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, What you should know

coverages.coverage_name: Chinese medicine practitioner, physiotherapist and chiropractor expenses

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses expenses for treatment received overseas from a Chinese medicine practitioner, physiotherapist, or chiropractor due to an unexpected illness or injury suffered overseas on the trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Chinese medicine practitioner, physiotherapist, and chiropractor expenses

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Treatment must be sought overseas OR within 48 hours of returning to Singapore. Claimable only if you received medical treatment overseas for the same illness/injury being treated in Singapore, OR if you seek medical treatment within 48 hours of returning to Singapore for the illness/injury suffered overseas. Excludes treatment from an interested party.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Treatment while on a trip or within 48 hours... / You can only claim this benefit if... / What is not covered

base_limits.type: Child covered under a family plan
Sub-limit for dental expenses caused by accident

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses costs for medically necessary treatment received in Singapore after returning from the trip, for an unexpected illness or injury suffered while overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Medical expenses incurred in Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Treatment must be sought overseas OR within 48 hours of returning to Singapore. Covers treatment for up to 30 days from the date you return to Singapore (if treatment sought within 48 hours). Includes accidental dental, ambulance, specialist (if referred), mobility aids (no prosthesis), medical equipment. Claimable only if you received medical treatment overseas for the same illness/injury OR sought treatment within 48 hours of returning. Excludes dental for tooth/gum disease/wear, non-natural teeth, treatment by interested party.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Treatment must be sought... / You can only claim... / What we pay / What is not covered

coverages.coverage_name: Daily hospital cash while in Singapore

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 8, Daily hospital cash while in Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a daily benefit for each continuous 24-hour period you are confined to a hospital in Singapore as a result of an unexpected illness or injury suffered while overseas on the trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 21, Daily hospital cash while in Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Confinement must occur within 48 hours of your return to Singapore; OR within 30 days after returning if you had sought medical treatment for the condition during your trip. Admission must be medically necessary. Daily amount doubled if confined in ICU (capped at S$200/day).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 21, Daily hospital cash while in Singapore / Double daily hospital cash benefit for ICU

limits.basis: S$50 for every six hours of delay

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 28, Pet care

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays benefit if your scheduled public transport back to Singapore is delayed for 6 continuous hours or more, provided the delay was not caused by you, your family member or travel companion. Requires your pet to be staying in a pet hotel or kennel during your trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Pet care

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Benefit is paid for each 6-hour period you are delayed in reaching Singapore.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, What we pay

limits.type: Sub-limit for rental of replacement equipment

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 28-29, Sports equipment protector

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers owned sports equipment (golf clubs, diving gear, skis, snowboards, wakeboards, bicycles, fishing tackle) and specialist apparel (diving, skiing, snowboarding) if stolen, accidentally damaged, or lost/stolen by airline/transport/accommodation provider during trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Sports equipment protector / Sports equipment definition

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for renting replacement equipment (up to S$100/day) and compensation for the stolen/damaged equipment based on depreciation (Bought during trip: 100%; 1 yr old: 70%; 2 yrs old: 50%; 3+ yrs old: 20% of purchase price, capped at benefit limit).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 29, What we pay / How much we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Equipment must have been under your care, securely locked, or in care of authorized person. Theft must be reported to police/authority within 24 hours. Excludes damage that happens while equipment is in use (practice or play).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 29, What you should know / What is not covered

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 30, Home contents

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays benefit if your home contents (household furniture, furnishings, domestic electronic appliances, personal belongings owned by you and in your home) are lost or damaged due to fire or burglary while you are overseas on your trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 30, Home contents definition / What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: FWD decides whether to replace, repair, or pay cash. Payment based on depreciation with proof of purchase (<1yr: 70%; 1-2yrs: 50%; 2-3yrs: 30%; >3yrs: 20% of price, capped at limit). Without proof, pays current market value up to S$50/item (max 5 items). Damaged items may become FWD property. Excludes cash and travellers' cheques.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 30, What we pay / How much we pay / Home contents definition & Page 36, How we pay property claims
